critique: This document pertains to the extension of a trust period for land allotments to specific members of the Red Lake Chippewa Tribe. It is a very specific action, and it is difficult to assess broad political biases based solely on this document. The document appears neutral in terms of ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion. The extension of the trust period could be seen as a continuation of existing policy, rather than a shift in any particular direction. Therefore, initial scores are all set to 0.
